title: Sausage And Egg Casserole
instructions: Brown sausage over medium heat. Drain fat. Place sausage in a greased 2 quart casserole dish.

title: Squash Casserole
instructions: Cook and drain squash.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
Mix sour cream, soup and onion in a small bowl.
In another bowl, pour melted butter over dressing; mix well.
Alternate layers (2) of squash, soup and dressing in casserole dish.
Bake at 375° for 30 minutes.

title: Black Bean Chili In 20 Minutes
instructions: Saute onion in oil or wine.
Add green pepper, garlic and cumin.
Stir in chili powder and saute.
Add beans and tomatoes. Stir in brown sugar.
Cover; simmer on low heat for 10 minutes. Serve over couscous or brown rice.
Top with cheese over a baked potato.
Can be used as a dip with tortilla chips.

title: Milk And Egg Free Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Grease either a 9-inch round or a 8-inch square cake pan.
Sift flour, sugar and soda together.
Mix applesauce, oil and vanilla in a bowl; add the dry ingredients and stir just until flour is moistened.
Spread batter into prepared pan.
Bake 30 minutes.
For a 2-layer cake, double the recipe.

title: Strawberry Milkshake
instructions: Combine ingredients into blender.
Blend on high until smooth.

title: Cream Cheese Pound Cake
instructions: Cream butter and cream cheese together until well blended. Add sugar and cream well.
Add egg and flour alternately, mixing well after each addition.
Add vanilla.
Bake at 325° for 1 1/2 hours in greased and floured tube pan.

title: Ice Box Fruit Cake
instructions: Roll graham crackers with rolling pin until very fine.
Melt marshmallows and add milk in double boiler.
Mix all the other ingredients toegther.
Pour melted marshmallows and milk over them.
Mix well and pack in cracker box or roll.
Put in refrigerator 24 hours before cutting.

title: Pork Chops
instructions: Brown pork chops in deep skillet.
Chop onion and add to chops in pan, then stewed tomatoes and rest of ingredients.
Cover and simmer 30 minutes until done.

title: Creamy Pimento Cheese Spread
instructions: Position knife blade in food processor bowl.
Add first five ingredients.
Process until smooth.
Add pimento.
Pulse 4 or 5 times.

title: Lemon Fruit Salad
instructions: Use 2 cups of drained fruit juice and mix with instant lemon pudding.
Let thicken a little.
Combine with completely drained fruit.
Add lemon juice and bananas before serving.

title: Church Window Cookies
instructions: Melt chocolate chips and butter in double boiler.
While melting, prepare other ingredients.

title: Chicken And Broccoli With Mushroom Sauce
instructions: Mix margarine and flour together in saucepan.
Cook briefly over medium heat.
Blend in chicken broth, stirring constantly until thickened and smooth.
Stir in mushrooms and their liquid. Season to taste.
Place broccoli pieces in a shallow baking pan. Cover with sliced chicken and pour mushroom sauce over all.
Top with parsley and bread crumbs.
Bake at 375°, uncovered, for 15 to 25 minutes or until bubbly and brown on top.

title: Stuffed Celery
instructions: Wash celery and cut into small pieces, about 2-inch strips. Combine raisins, olives, cream cheese and mayonnaise and stir until ingredients are mixed well.
Fill celery pieces and chill.

title: Chicken Nacho Dip
instructions: Reserve 1 teaspoon taco seasoning mix; set aside.
Combine remaining taco seasoning mix, chicken, beer and chiles in a large skillet.
Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes or until mixture is thickened.
Remove from heat; stir in salsa.

title: Sugar-Free Doughnuts
instructions: Cream shortening and margarine in bowl.
Add mashed potatoes, potato water, sweetener and egg; beat well.
Sprinkle with yeast. Stir in gently.
Let stand
for 1 1/2 hours in warm place.
Stir in flour gradually.
Knead on floured surface until smooth.
Let rise, covered, in warm place 5 to 6 hours or doubled in bulk. Roll out on floured surface 1/2-inch thick.
Cut to desired size. Place on floured towel.
Let rise in warm place 1 1/2 to 2 inches or until doubled in bulk.
Deep fry in 375°
oil until light brown.
Drain on paper towels.
Yields 50 doughnuts.

title: Ham Balls
instructions: Roll in balls and bake 10 minutes.

title: Baked Beans With Hamburger
instructions: Use medium skillet.
Cook bacon until crisp; set aside.
Empty grease and use same pan.
Saute onion and beef until brown. Remove onion and beef with slotted spoon.
Put in 2-quart casserole and stir in salt.
Discard drippings.
Add cooked bacon. Preheat oven to 375°.
In skillet add remaining ingredients and heat until hot, stirring occasionally.
Pour into casserole and stir well.
Bake uncovered for 60 minutes.

title: Sweet And Sour Cocktail Meatballs
instructions: Mix beef, bread crumbs, eggs, soup mix and Accent.
Roll into bite size pieces.
Arrange on cookie sheet.
Bake at 350° for approximately 15 minutes.

title: Mock Apple Pie
instructions: Roll out half the pastry and line a 9-inch pie plate.
Place crackers in crust.
In saucepan over high heat, bring water, sugar and cream of tartar to boil; simmer for 15 minutes.
Add lemon juice and rind; cool.
Pour syrup over crackers.
Dot with spread. Sprinkle with cinnamon.
Roll out remaining pastry; place over pie. Trim, seal and flute edges.
Slit top crust to allow steam to escape.
Bake at 425° for 30 to 35 minutes or until crust is golden.
Cool completely.

title: Raisin Cream Pie
instructions: Boil raisins and water slowly until most of the water is taken up.
Add the 1 1/2 cup milk; mix remaining ingredients with the 1/2 cup of half and half and add to the raisins and cook until thick.
Top with meringue from egg whites.

title: Mom'S Meat Loaf
instructions: Put everything in bowl. Mix together. Place in pan. Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

title: Date Roll
instructions: Melt margarine and marshmallows in pan over low heat.
Chop dates and nuts.
Add to margarine-marshmallow mixture.
Spread about 1 cup graham cracker crumbs on wax paper.
Shape mixture into long roll.
Lay on graham crackers and roll up.
Chill; slice thin.

title: Chipped Beef Appetizer
instructions: Combine all ingredients.
Bake 30 to 40 minutes at 350°. Serve with crackers.

title: Sweet And Sour Chicken(Chinese)
instructions: In large skillet or wok, stir-fry onion in garlic and ginger in hot oil for 1 minute.
Add peppers and stir until crisp-tender.
Remove from pan and add chicken.
Stir-fry until cooked.
Return vegetables to pan.
Mix cornstarch with soy sauce, pineapple juice, vinegar and sugar.
Pour into pan.
Add pineapple chunks.
Bring to a full boil.
Serve with hot rice.
Makes 4 servings.

title: Beer Bread
instructions: Mix all ingredients and place in 2 greased 9 x 5-inch loaf pans.
Start in cold oven.
Bake 60 to 70 minutes.
Butter top 15 to 20 minutes before done.

title: Zucchini Bread
instructions: Combine oil, eggs, sugar and zucchini.
Add vanilla and blend well.
Mix dry ingredients together.
Stir dry ingredients into egg mixture, a small amount at a time.
Stir in nuts and raisins. Do not beat.
Bake at 325° for 1 hour in small loaf pans or 1 1/2 hours in large cake pan.

title: Chicken A La King
instructions: Saute mushrooms and green pepper in butter.
Blend in flour and seasonings.
Cook over low heat, stirring, until mixture is smooth and bubbly.
Remove from heat.
Slowly stir in broth and cream.
Bring to boil over low heat, stirring constantly.
Boil for 1 minute.
Add chicken and pimento; continue cooking until meat is heated through.
Serve over noodles.

title: Lemon Salad Supreme
instructions: Dissolve gelatin in water.
Add lemon juice and salad dressing and mix well.
Chill in refrigerator until mixture begins to congeal.
Beat well; add remaining ingredients and mix.
Pour into lightly oiled 2-quart mold.
Chill until set.
Unmold on salad greens and garnish as desired.

title: Lamb And Okra Stew
instructions: Brown meat in oil, then add a small amount of water.
Cover and allow to simmer until almost tender (15 to 20 minutes).
Add okra and garlic to the meat and simmer for another 15 minutes.
Peel tomatoes and whirl in blender, then add to meat and okra.
Add salt, pepper and lemon juice.
Cook on low heat until okra is tender and sauce is set.
Chicken or beef can be used instead of lamb.
Serve over rice.

title: Twinkie Cake
instructions: Slice Twinkies in half and place cream side up in bottom of 9 x 13-inch pan.
Slice bananas on top of Twinkies.
Prepare pudding as per directions and combine with well drained pineapple.
Pour this over bananas.
Next, smooth Cool Whip over top and sprinkle on nuts.
Keep refrigerated.

title: Sausage Balls
instructions: Mix and shape into small balls.
Cook at 375° for 10 to 15 minutes.

title: Easy Cottage Cheese Loaf
instructions: Mix well and turn into greased pan.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

title: Apple Surprise
instructions: Place pie filling in a 9 x 13 inch cake pan.
Sprinkle lemon juice over the pie filling with.
Add one part of the cinnamon over the mixture.
Cover filling with dry cake mix, do not stir. Sprinkle with the remaining cinnamon.
Drizzle melted butter over the cake mix.
Spread nuts over top of cake.
Bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 40 minutes, until topping is bubbly.

title: Buttercream Frosting
instructions: In a small mixing bowl, cream butter; add 1/3 of the sugar and beat well.
Add egg, vanilla, salt and cream; beat until smooth. Gradually add remaining sugar, beating until smooth.
If frosting is too thick, additional cream may be added.

title: Creamy Pasta With Mushrooms
instructions: Prepare fettuccine as directed on package.
Drain and set aside. Gradually add skim milk to fat-free mayonnaise and garlic in small saucepan.
Heat thoroughly, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat; blend in Egg Beaters.
Toss with fettuccine and mushrooms until well coated.
Add Parmesan cheese and mix well.

title: Guinea Garbage
instructions: Slice peppers and onions, then saute them in a large skillet with a little oil.
Transfer when tender to a large pot.
Add one can of tomato sauce and the spices listed.
Let simmer after mixing well.
Cook the sausages and drain the fat.
Place whole sausages in the sauce and cover them well with the sauce.
Taste sauce and spice accordingly.
Serve on sub rolls.

title: Strawberry Delight
instructions: Break angel food cake in small pieces.
Layer in pan.
Dissolve jello in hot water.
Allow to thicken slightly.
Add berries to jello, pour over cake and chill.
Mix instant pudding, then whip together with ice cream.
Pour this over jello cake.
Chill until firm, then cover with Cool Whip.
Delicious!

title: Cheese And Sour Cream Potatoes
instructions: Combine potatoes, soup, sour cream, cheese, onion and salt and pepper and put in a 9 x 13 inch greased glass dish.
Mix melted butter and bread crumbs together and spread over top of potato mixture.
Bake for 45 minutes in a preheated 350° oven.

title: Tree Bark
instructions: Line large cookie sheet with tinfoil.
Arrange saltines to cover tray.
Combine butter and brown sugar. Pour over crackers and bake at 400° for seven minutes.
Remove and pour one cup chocolate chips over.
Spread until melted.
Chill 2 to 3 hours. Lift and break into pieces.

title: Mayonnaise Cake
instructions: Mix together.
Bake 25 minutes at 350°.

title: Kahlua Pound Cake
instructions: Mix all ingredients and pour into a greased and floured bundt pan.
Bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes.
Check often with toothpick.
If you don't add pecans, you don't have to flour pan.

title: Black Olive Cheese Ball
instructions: Blend together first three ingredients.
Add olives and chives.
Mold into ball and refrigerate.
Sprinkle with paprika and serve.

title: Mexican Dip
instructions: Spread softened cream cheese in baking dish.
Top with chili and then cheese.
Bake at 325° for 10 minutes.
Let cool.
Serve with nacho chips.

title: Wedding Potatoes
instructions: Spread potatoes in 9 x 13-inch cake pan.
Mix sour cream, soup, cheese, onion and 1/2 stick melted butter together.
Spread over potatoes.
Mix 1/2 stick melted butter and bread crumbs and spread over potatoes.
Bake at 375° for 1 hour.

title: Cherry Squares
instructions: Cream butter and sugar until very light.
Add flour, eggs and flavoring.
Beat until light again.
Spread in greased 15 1/2 x 10 1/2-inch pan.
Cut batter into 28 squares.
Spoon pie filling into center of each square.
Bake at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.
Cool. Cut into squares and sprinkle with powdered sugar.

title: Vanilla Ice Cream
instructions: Mix together with mixer.
Pour into 4-quart container and freeze according to manufacturer's instructions.
If fruit is added, cut milk to about 4 1/2 cups.

title: Pasta Frola (Guava Torte)
instructions: Sift together the dry ingredients.
Add the margarine to the dry ingredients with a pastry blender.
Add the eggs and the milk. Roll out 3/4 of the dough into a circle.
Save the other part for the top.

title: Texas State Fair Blue Ribbon Chili
instructions: Simmer for 1 hour.

title: Meat Loaf
instructions: Mix all together.
Shape into 2 loaves.
Bake at 350° for 60 minutes.

title: Strawberry Pie
instructions: Boil sugar, cornstarch and water until thick.
Add gelatin; mix thoroughly.
Place fresh berries in pie shell.
Pour gelatin mixture over strawberries.
Chill until set.
Top with whipped topping if desired.

title: Chicken And Broccoli Casserole
instructions: Heat oven to 350°. Cut up sausage into small pieces and cook. Melt cheese, add soup to cheese, stir until well blended.
Cook broccoli. In a seperate bowl mix stuffing, sausage, celery and onions.
Place cut up chicken in bottom of pan, then broccoli, then pour soup and cheese mixture on top. Top with stuffing mixture.
Bake for 40 min. till cheese bubbles and stuffing browns.

title: Pork Barbecue Sauce
instructions: Combine all ingredients and bring to a good boil.
Can also be used for chicken.

title: Mock Whipped Cream Icing
instructions: Put all ingredients together in bowl and beat thoroughly, about 7 minutes.

title: Vegetable Casserole
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Use an ungreased 2-quart casserole dish.
Cook broccoli and Brussels sprouts as directed on packages. After 5 minutes add cauliflower.
Cook until tender.
Drain well.

title: Raisin And Nut Bran Muffins
instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Grease a 2 inch muffin tin. Combine bran and milk in a bowl and let sit for 5 minutes.
Then mash with the back of spoon.
Sift together the flour and sugar and add to bran.
Add the beaten egg and the melted butter and stir until well blended, Do not beat.
Stir in the nuts and raisins. Divide batter amount the muffin cups.
Bake 15 to 20 minutes. Makes 12 muffins.

title: Easy Beef Stew
instructions: Baking Temperature: 300°.
Baking Time: 4 hours.

title: Chocolate Pound Cake
instructions: Cream oleo and shortening with sugar.
Add eggs one at a time and blend well after each.
Sift dry ingredients together and add alternately with milk.
Add vanilla.
Pour batter into greased and floured tube pan.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour and 25 minutes.

title: Old Fashioned Apple Crisp
instructions: Place filling in shallow one quart baking dish.
In a bowl, combine flour, oats, sugar, salt and spices.
Cut in butter and mix well.
Spread topping evenly over apple filling.
Bake in 375° oven for about 30 minutes.
Serve warm or cold.
Serves 6.

title: Broccoli Cornbread
instructions: Mix together the butter, eggs, cottage cheese, cornbread mix and salt.
Add the broccoli and onion.
Grease dish.
Bake at 375° for 40 to 45 minutes.

title: Our Favorite Pound Cake
instructions: Blend sugar, salt and mace in large mixing bowl. Cream the sugar mixture and butter until light and fluffy.
Add extracts. Beat eggs into mixture, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add parts of flour and milk to creamed mixture alternately, blending well after each addition.
When smooth, turn batter into greased and floured 10-inch tube pan.
Bake in a moderate oven at 350° for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until cake tester comes out clean and cake is golden brown.
Allow cake to cool 5 minutes in pan. Turn out on cooling rack.
Cool thoroughly.

title: Green Bean And Mozzarella Salad
instructions: Mix all ingredients together in large bowl.
Cover and refrigerate 1 hour before serving.
Makes 4 to 6 servings.

title: Super Nachos
instructions: In a large skillet, cook meat until brown; drain.
Add seasonings and water; simmer for 20 minutes.
Spread bean dip over large 12 x 14-inch pizza pan.
Sprinkle with cheeses; top with meat and chopped chilies and bake until bubbly.
Arrange lettuce, tomatoes and tortillas around edge and serve.

title: Orange Glazed Carrots
instructions: In a small saucepan, combine sugar, cornstarch, salt and ginger.
Add orange juice.
Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly.
Cook 1 to 2 minutes more.
Stir in butter and pour over hot carrots.
Stir to coat.

title: Pecan Pralines
instructions: Cook sugars and milk until forms soft ball in cold water. Remove from heat.
Add butter and beat until creamy.
Add pecans and vanilla.
Drop on waxed paper.
Makes 30 pieces.

title: Skillet Bread
instructions: Put 1/2 fat in skillet.
Place in preheated oven to heat while mixing bread.
Mix wet ingredients.
Mix the dry ingredients, then mix combine both mixtures.
Pour into hot skillet and bake 20 minutes at 425° or until top is crusty brown.
This recipe doubles and triples easily, but for best results must be cooked in an iron skillet.

title: Broccoli Casserole
instructions: Combine
all ingredients except cracker crumbs and pour into greased
baking
dish.
Sprinkle with cracker crumbs and bake at 350° for 45 minutes.
Serves 6 to 8.

title: Oven Baked Potato Wedges
instructions: Set oven to 400°.
Melt butter into baking pan.
Set aside. Cut clean potatoes into wedges.
Mix Ranch package, flour and cheese in a small paper or plastic bag.
Shake potato wedges in bag until well coated.
Bake in butter-coated pan until lightly brown and tender in the middle.
You should turn them over while baking to brown both sides.

title: Homemade Canned Spaghetti Sauce
instructions: Boil for 2 hours.
Add 3 cups of sugar and cook 15 minutes more.
Put in hot jars.

title: Lettuce Salad
instructions: Drain pineapple and oranges.
Stir over low heat until coated the almonds and sugar.
Cool and break apart.
Set aside.
Put remaining ingredients in a plastic bag.

title: Cream Of Broccoli Soup
instructions: Fry together butter and onion until brown.
Add flour and stir.
Add canned soup, milk and broccoli.
Simmer 15 minutes or until broccoli is cooked.
Add shredded Cheddar cheese and simmer 10 minutes.

title: Pickled Eggs
instructions: Boil ingredients and place over hot eggs with beets on top in a glass container.
Leave it sit out until cool, then refrigerate.

title: Sunshine Salad
instructions: Dissolve jello in hot water, add cold water; stir. Add pineapple; allow to cool but not gel. Add carrots and stir to distribute evenly. Place in refrigerate to congeal.

title: Easter Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°.
Roll out half of dough and line 9-inch buttered pie pan.
Saute peppers and ham in oil 3 minutes; season with pepper.
Whisk 2 eggs and Ricotta in large bowl.
Spread mixture in pastry shell.
Pat spinach dry.
Sprinkle on top. Sprinkle saute mix over spinach and top with Mozzarella.
Add basil.
Roll out remaining dough and cover pie.
Trim edges.
Cut 4 vents and brush top with beaten egg.
Bake 50 to 60 minutes or until golden brown.
Set 20 minutes and serve.

title: Cousin Carol'S Seafood Sauce
instructions: In a saucepan, add oil and minced garlic.
Chop parsley leaves and add to saucepan.
Stir until parsley is limp.
Add seafood (cleaned and de-shelled).
Add tomato sauce, wine and basil.
The sauce should be a light red-pink color.
Reduce liquid until meat is just showing through the liquid.
If you are using all fresh seafood, add a can of clam juice to add flavor to the sauce. Reduce as noted before.
Cook spaghetti until it is al dente.
Add sauce; toss and serve.

title: Hamburger Pie
instructions: Brown beef, onion and bell pepper.
Add sauce.
Spread crescent rolls in buttered pan, then spread beef mix, then cheese, etc., putting cheese on top.
Cook in oven at 350° to 400° until done, about 20 to 25 minutes.

title: Lemon Squares
instructions: Mix margarine, powdered sugar and 1 cup flour together and pat in bottom of 9 x 13-inch pan.
Bake at 350° for 15 minutes.
While baking, mix rest of ingredients together on low speed.
Pour on hot crust and continue baking for 20 minutes.
Dust with powdered sugar while warm.
Cut when cool.

title: Stuffed Cabbage Rolls
instructions: Mix ground beef, rice, onion, salt and pepper well.
Form into good size balls and wrap in cabbage leaves.
Fasten with toothpicks.
Place in large pot; cover with canned tomato soup. Simmer for 45 minutes to an hour.
Shredded cabbage may be placed between layers of rolls to give more flavor to the sauce.
Serves 4 to 6.

title: Cherry Delight Dump Cake
instructions: Dump cherry filling in a 9 x 13-inch oblong pan.
Then dump pineapple.
Then sprinkle cake mix on top of that.
Melt margarine and pour over cake mix.
On top of this add Angel Flake coconut and top with pecans.
Bake for 1 hour at 325°.
Serve warm with ice cream or it's good cold.
Serve from the same pan.

title: Whipped Cream
instructions: Beat the cream, vanilla and sugar to a thick consistency. Refrigerate.

title: Chocolate Bottom Bites
instructions: Combine first 5 ingredients in a large bowl; make a well in the center of mixture.
Combine water, oil, vinegar and vanilla; add to dry ingredients, stirring well.
Spoon batter into paper-lined miniature muffin pans, filling 2/3 full.

title: Mema Weimar'S Macaroni And Cheese
instructions: Bring water to boil.
Add macaroni and cook for about 15 minutes.
Drain.
Place in pan and pour the can of tomatoes (mashed good) over top.
Add bacon grease and grated cheese.
Add salt and pepper to taste; stir all together.
Sprinkle some grated cheese on top and bacon bits.
Bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes.

title: Meat Loaf With Zesty Topping
instructions: Pour milk over bread crumbs.
Add ground beef, salt, pepper, carrot, onion and eggs.
Mix thoroughly.
Pack in a 9 x 5-inch loaf pan.

title: Chinese Barbecued Pork
instructions: Cut pork into long strips about 2 inches wide and 2 inches thick.
Soak the first six ingredients for half a day or overnight.
Rub the meat (at room temperature) with garlic, sugar and honey.
Heat oven at 400°.
Roast the pork for 35 minutes, turning strips over once during roasting process.
Remove pork from oven and slice.

title: Clam Fritters
instructions: Heat oil to 375°.
Mix all ingredients until thick and stays on spoon.
Pat batter into pan to form patty.
Brown on each side. Serve hot.
Good leftover and in sandwiches.

title: Cheese Dip
instructions: Dice tomatoes and peppers.
Combine all ingredients in top of double boiler for 30 minutes.
Serve hot over corn chips.

title: Apple Impromtuv
instructions: Put apple pie filling on bottom of 8-inch square cake pan. Mix remaining ingredients.
Spread mixture over top of pie filling. Sprinkle lightly with cinnamon.
Bake at 400° for 25 minutes.

title: Broccoli And Chicken
instructions: Mix together all ingredients and top with Pepperidge Farm dry stuffing mix.
Top with butter and heat in a microwave to serve.

title: Ham And Swiss Pinwheels
instructions: Sprinkle flour over work surface.
Turn dough out onto floured surface and roll into a 12-inch square.
Combine mustard and honey in small bowl and brush over dough.
Sprinkle evenly with cheese. Top with ham slices.
Roll up jelly roll fashion, pinching seam to seal (don't seal ends).
Cut roll into 16 slices.
Place slices, cut side down, on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray.
Cover and let rise in a warm place (85°) for 45 minutes.
Bake at 350° for 15 to 18 minutes, or until golden.
Serve immediately.
Yields 16.

title: Strawberry Pie
instructions: Mash 1/2 of the strawberries well.
Add cornstarch and salt, then water.
Cook mixture until thick and transparent; cool.
Add remaining strawberries to the cooked filling.
Pour into cooled crust.
Garnish with whipped cream.

title: Special Beef Stroganoff
instructions: Brown onion in hot shortening.
Drain.
Stir in the remaining ingredients.
Turn into a greased casserole and bake for 1 hour in a 325° oven.
Serve hot on cooked rice.

title: Pam'S Meat Loaf
instructions: Soak bread crumbs in milk; add meat, eggs, onion and seasonings.
Mix well.
Form in individual loaves; place in greased muffin pans.
Cover with Piquant Sauce.
Bake in a moderate 350° oven for 45 minutes.
Makes 8 servings.
Or form one loaf in 8 1/2 x 4 1/2 x 2 1/2-inch pan.
Spread with sauce; bake 1 hour.

title: Earthquake Cake
instructions: Mix coconut and nuts.
Press into 9 x 13-inch pan.
Mix cake mix as directed.
Pour over nuts and coconut.
Mix cream cheese, powdered sugar and margarine.
Drop by teaspoonfuls on top of cake mix (will almost completely cover top).
Bake at 350° for 45 minutes to 1 hour.

title: Tropical Coconut Pineapple Bars
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°.
Lightly grease 9 x 13 pan.
Prepare cake mix using 1/2 cup yogurt and 1 egg.
Spread batter onto the bottom of prepared pan.
Bake 10 minutes.
While baking, in a bowl mix remaining yogurt, egg, pineapple, brown sugar and coconut. Carefully spread yogurt mixture on top of partially baked batter. Bake bars 25 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool completely before cutting into bars.
Mix confectioners sugar and 2 tablespoons reserved pineapple juice to create a glaze.
Drizzle over cooked bars.

title: Corn Muffins
instructions: Combine all dry ingredients.
Combine milk, egg and oil.
Add to dry ingredients; stir quickly.
Fill greased muffin pans 2/3 full.
Bake at 425° for 12 to 15 minutes.

title: Chicken Casserole
instructions: Fully cook chicken; bone and put into 9 x 13-inch pan.
Pour soup over chicken.
Make stuffing as directed on box; spread over soup.
Bake about 1/2 hour at 375° to 400°.

title: Chicken L'Orange
instructions: Mix all ingredients together and pour over chicken in baking dish.
Bake, covered, at 350° for 35 minutes; uncover and bake for an additional 20 minutes.

title: Confirmation Auction Cavatini
instructions: Brown sausage in skillet. Cook noodles separately until tender. Drain noodles. Mix sausage, noodles and spaghetti sauce in a casserole dish. Sprinkle cheese on top and bake until melted.

title: Finger Paint
instructions: Dissolve soap chips in water until they're not lumpy.
Mix well with starch.
Use on heavy paper with plenty of newspapers underneath.

title: Chicken Spaghetti
instructions: Cook spaghetti and drain.
Mix all other ingredients together.
Add to spaghetti, place in a 13x9 casserole dish.
Cook for 30 minutes at 350 degrees.

title: Turkey Tetrazzini
instructions: Cook noodles, uncovered, in boiling water for 20 minutes. Drain.
Combine soup, milk, water and Cheddar cheese in 3-quart saucepan.
Cook over medium heat until cheese melts and sauce is hot; stir constantly.
Stir in cooked noodles, turkey, peas, carrots and pimento.
Spoon mixture into greased 9 x 13-inch baking dish.
